item.title: Find Go Project
item.description: I have so many go projects in go path. Since i didnt bookmarked all projects, so each time i need to go to $GOPATH and cd to that package name. Here is my script for current solution. Assume your target project is in 3 depth of src. function findgo() { find $GOPATH/src -mindepth 3 -maxdepth 3 -type d -exec ls -ld "{}" \; | grep $1 | awk '{ print $9 }' | nl } âžœ ~ findgo proto 1 /Users/tommy/go-workspace/src/google.
